title: ﻿campus
text:
an ocean 
of clouds
and the 
orgasmic 
sun bursting 
through
to wash the sky 
with pinks 
and blues
an acorn cracks 
beneath my feet
without my 
headphones
I hear 
the lost 
dreams
of students 
in the 
motorway’s 
drone
the empty 
campus
retreating 
to darkness
leaves 
the cows calm 
beneath the 
milky clouds
and I hear
the birds
twitter
the sun 
talking to the 
tallest 
branches
that stretch 
towards 
heaven

title: ﻿evening poem
text:
at dusk all the bees are in their beds
little white flowers spread over the grass look 
like flecks of cocaine
soon to be hoovered 
up by 
my lawnmower
I am the stillness of the trees
and the whir of the motorway
I am the little bats
that dance 
around my resting 
head
their little wings nodding 
at the dead

title: two lonely children
text:
you're all talk and
I'm all talk too
we dance
and dance
until our heads are 
spinning
just for a chance
to say that we're 
winning
don't look 
inside
to what we cover up
two lonely children
in our 
hearts 
are stuck

title: father’s day poem
text:
to dad
I write 
the cursive 
in the 
card
free and 
easy
happy 
father's day
I don't 
elaborate
I know 
you are 
understated
and you'll feel it
either way
I sign 
my 
brother's name
like he 
did it 
himself
it is all done
with love

title: pub poem
text:
the bells chime across the eternal tiled floor
a distant grandfather clock ticks in the backroom
the waitress teases me with looks
that I half imagine
running back and forth between the nooks and crannies
I resist looking back 
but how I would like to unlock her 
we would lay in my victorian bed 
her skinny legs
and feet would touch me
as cold as a cadaver 
in this pub many strange people come and go
I sip my coffee 
fireplace to my left
trying to look interesting
waiting for something beautiful
to happen

title: on the avanti west coast train to glasgow
text:
it's raining outside
but always sunny in my head 

I see myself on the camera and
question
where does all the cctv go?

more creating
and letting go 
less criticising
and chastising

as the glorious greens of the countryside 
pour into my dream cup

three cheers for 
a lack of control 
and
what comes 
what comes 
what comes!

title: say yes
text:
standing on bus stop trolleys
cycling on curbs with a flat tire 
having someone say yes
makes me dumb
dancing through the streets 
like a new film 
new promises
and the old 
fear 
to let someone 
know
and to have them 
reciprocate
to even 
suggest
is exquisite 
to exist
and to let all the songs 
sing in my
heart

title: electric shoulder touch
text:
electric shoulder touch
promise 
dash of raspberry 
cordial
guinness poorly
poured
all the while 
I long to 
touch you 
back 
however 
incidental
a gentle movement
a brush past
instead 
we talk and laugh 
and the 
electricity 
of that touch 
fades

halted by the fleeting moment
we embrace 
and let the 
scarlet wishbone
break

title: untitled
text:
the orange and brown 
leaves
have fallen 
in elwood streets 
the avenues of 
trees
and the warm winds
when I see you it's with 
an open mind
a space to be 
and the greek girl 
at the bakery
what is her mystery?
the secret story
of her
internal 
life

title: my bloody valentine
text:
I'll never
be able
to listen to 
my bloody valentine
the same 
again

life changed 

singing to the empty streets 
I'll be your plastic toy 
I'll be your plastic toy
I'll be your plastic toy!

title: the last of my weed
text:
I threw the last 
of my 
weed 
away
laid it out 
in my palm 
flat
and offered it 
to the fat horizon 
to the grey sea
to the little fishies
and to bob marley

cannabis
you have grown tiresome 
stuck playing the same note

I throw it far into the waves 
and it plops 
and it's gone
suddenly like 
northern lights 
an apparition 
shines 
up towards me

I shake myself out of a dream
rub my schnozzle
fasten my coat
and begin the 
long journey 
home
against 
the 
wicked wind

title: melbourne park poem
text:
I sink into the grass
because I am the fields and grass
my limbs spread across acres 
of cheshire oaks 
I feel at one with the pigeons
I offer up my coconut cake
by laying it at their pink feet
and jerky little heads
then lounge back 
eating my orange like a panther
sunning itself
slothfully savouring the fresh juices 
and I realise that I'm totally grateful
to my work colleagues for
not including me
this bringing forth my hatred 
and my bitterness 
so I can meet it 
with tenderness 
so that it cracks like a rock
and my soul emerges

title: drinking problem
text:
in life you have to give yourself 
hangover
arms open
second coffee
I will stop drinking 
I will stop
the neon empty promises
the sex dreams on sticky floors
I want to 
peer behind the 
beer mat
take a deep breath
and see the cockroaches
 scurry when the lights
come on
surrender to nights alone
lime and soda
surrounded by throes of people 
stuck in white heat 
all so I can give more
of myself 
to the people 
I care about
for everything 
in the 
world
I want to
 give 
all of 
me

title: hangover poem
text:
I am a sensitive boy
so wanting to be included
but when it comes
I push it away 
the group today
especially feels my
derision 
because
I'm hungover 
I don't like pandering 
and fawning 
I sit and watch 
my manager display
it in 
droves 
the secret alliances 
and barriers 
marked out 
to keep mouths 
complicit and silent 
to outsiders 
the sound of nasal laughter
from inside the walls 
makes me 
feel sick

it might 
just be 
the 8 
pints

title: to my panicked part
text:
to my panicked part
I know you feel so alone 
but you aren't anymore 
I'm sorry I wasn't here for so long
but I didn't know
now in 2024 
I come as your friend 
I want to be your best friend
the insurmountable task
I can do them 
we can keep reminding each other 
we're here
until things are free and easy 
I want to go through it all
with you 
listen to old jazz records with you 
dream of the amalfi coast with you…

title: afca poem
text:
I walk 
with my white coffee cup
happily passing all my city chums
with their own white cups 

matcha green tea 
bianca the red haired sycophant
sucking up to the cool crew 
as I watch

I breath
I block
I blame

please take a seat 
the manager 
says into the microphone 
take responsibility 
I think 
as I park my bum 
at the 
operational excellence
annual 
get together

title: untitled
text:
so many
girls
to fall
in 
love with 
I didn't write 
enough
love 
poems 
I was 
in love 
with 
my own 
headaches

title: call to arms
text:
depressed?
anxious?
ptsd?
call me! 
time to reign it in fellas 
stop beating your wives!
stop beating yourselves over the head with a rusty kalashnikov 
hug your wife!
hug your children!
thank the postman
try a therapist on medicare and expand your life!
expand your wife's love for the world!
don't leave her
make love to her

fuck her really good like it's the last time!
one day it really will be the last time 
so pretend it's today!
and don't be scared to be the first one 
that's kind and tender
and loving
we need more love in the world!
together we don't have to get swept up
in our antisocial compulsions!
otherwise it's nil by mouth!
and your children and your children's children
and your nan and your uncle tom and even your own dear mother
everyone dead and alive you hold dear
will be travelling on a merry go round of shit and despair
for a very long time 
thank you

title: untitled
text:
in my girls new room
it's too intimate
and it hurts 
I dive right in 
the perxukiaruties of a good break up 
and no toxicity 
you dive back in 
she tells me to not think about it 

something that doesn't sound professional. but charming 

is this why we're growing up
to drink wine with our food
is this why I'm writing this 
to imagine quips I never sent to you 
it touches me to think of you sleeping here in the cold

title: breakup poem
text:
you are
sunshine
on red brick
terraces

you were mine
a slow
resonant 
note

but
but
and
above all 

you are 
a cold bright 
morning 
that lives in my
heart
forever

title: your look back
text:
even broken up 
we secretly sometimes meet
I don't care what anyone says about it not being healthy 
I want to see you 
we drink mulled wine 
and have a wandering sort of day 
in crisp winter cold 
you are the human being I am most comfortable with
even on a fresh hangover 

the wine goes to our heads
I rest my hand on your thigh under the table 
it makes me sad
the night feels strange and empty
apart from the touch of your hand 
your cheek
we say goodbye at the pub 
you walk away
but you looked back
you looked back 
and I hope to have that sweet joyous smile of yours 
uniquely yours 
etched into my memory 
for a long long time

title: fucking cunt
text:
fucking cunt
fucking cunt
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt

title: untitled
text:
sitting on the floor
saying hello to the flies 
sleepy but cracked open
lush grass relaxed 
the songs in my head feel different

although the demon sue haunts me 
with taunts of being an evil child 
and a "golden balls" simultaneously
like I could hold both ideals without cracking 
sue
you contributed to my negative self image
reckon with that through your many 
empty hangovers 
and your son who ran away from you to australia 

my mother said to me
that she's so sorry 
I had to go through what I did 
that she still feels like it's all her fault
and the tears I'm crying 
are the only raindrops
this island has ever seen

I reply that we're in it together
that I feel so much better after talking to her 
and the tears I'm crying 
are the only raindrops
this island has ever seen
let them flow from my cheek
in sweet release
and flow down to the lush grass
as my body relaxed

title: untitled
text:
I scoff my sushi to hide 
that I'm nervous and hurtie
6 dollars for four rolls of sushi 
prices unheard of on the british isles 
spicy tuna, terriyaki chicken
californian
and pork katsu 
I scoff to the gods
but the chit chat around me
has invisible subtexts
sinister 
as the tempura smacks between my lips 
I hear dark utterances
that say
you are not welcome here
but I stand tall
a statue of mossy stone 
my head reaches to the overcast sky 
the same heavy clouds in my stomach
leak rain from my eyes 
I stand as a writer that no one understands 
my brilliance falls short and is never heard
I stand before you a victim 
of the wicked and cowardly brads

we all have a brad in our lives
brad who won't cast his long lanky arms
around me
brad with his knuckles taut and strong 
wrapped around my neck 
dirty little brad
a silence 
then
   - did anyone go to the secret rave?
someone says
   - it wasn't so secret if everyone was posting about it on instagram 
brad scoffs
then he whispers to his friend 
right in front of us 
tell us the gossip brad!
I demand to hear it brad
and I realise how different I am to all these little oinks 
they walk away without any glances towwrds me
the sky rains deeply
no one loves me
not even brad

far from being sucked off 
the wound inside me sucks me in 
it sucks my love and my attention 
locks them away
and colours my life 
a pint of blood poured into all your evians 
drink piss and bitter tears

I actually made this poem to voice how you feel
so you are heard
and seen

I later learn that brad is gay maybe
so maybe I'll just bum his head off 
that'll shut him up 

we all have inner chambers of hurt 
looks are deceiving 
we can't presume because there is a constellation of parts in all of us 
inner dungeons 
but let's turn them into shag carpets 
with ifs is there any mystery left inside us ?
surely I don't know everything but but I feel like I do 
and hobbiton valleys 
the cosy feeling brings a tear to your eye
because you feel it is so far off 
but with my imagination 
I can help you...
I am here
I am with you 
it's just that others are more on show

title: the second place
text:
working on the floor
is like doing a silent buddhist retreat
it's too loud to talk
so I wander around the pub
collecting glasses
I yearn for the laughter of the bartenders
but I'm just a lowly 
food and beverage attendant 

I take a look around me
an autistic japanese couple
are bobbing their heads up and down
running about the place 
an older couple on the dancefloor 
are grinding so much
it would make usher blush
a beautiful spanish girl
has a poke at a ball with a pool cue
then looks dejected
the islander bouncer vilo
stares off into space
waiting for the night to be over 

later 
I take the bar mats downstairs 
to a dirty smelly corner 
the underground of the shopping centre 
I hang each one up with gloves
and the black residue from the mats 
drips onto my shoes and trousers
then I wash them down with a hose 

in between cleaning
a broken pigeon flutters down
and drinks from the disgusting pool of liquid 
left by the mats
my friend
a recognition
second place 
then I shoo it away

title: untitled
text:
all these people 
going to die 
in the sunshine 
I can't plan anything 
listening to the durutti column 
on my cycle into work
giving each face it's fair share
of attention 
at least I have you to hold me
and calm me down
at least I have you

title: red wine and a 50th birthday
text:
I'm fucking knackered me
sipping a beautiful big round red wine
trying to watch my glasses
but they slip and slip 
and here comes with a force
the serious writer man
inclined to disparage himself
as cold and serious 
huff puff 
well fuck that
grease is on the radio 
and I'm drinking through the campness
while I was once hesitant
now I am very excited to receive visitors
and I look forward to this weekend
andy's 50th!
so many incredible moments
bubbling through my head
in visioons
but I'll try and not to control it all
I will have the vape handy to take everything
to the next level

title: tiny climbing frame
text:
my tiny climbing frame
that once appeared so tall
goes up to my chest 
there's dinner cooking
in the streets of the westlands
and the trees...
how many stories
this whole area used to be trees and forests
until we got greedy and
fucked nature over 
the vast sky has cleared after rain
dripped away any dirt
leading to looseness 
as the children inside me scream
when I make contact
my back gives out from the pressure
tired of walking tall and stiff
for too long 
but I'm okay
I'm in love with the sky
and my parts 
the ones who need my help
and calming down 
cuddled in a blanket of clouds 
and caressed by the sun 
I will be there

title: does jonathan richman shave his pubes?
text:
does jonathan richman
shave his pubes?
he looks like a hairy lad 
what a beautiful boy
but if he dislikes the internet
and screw top wine
there is no chance 
that down there
is trimmed and fine
I love you jonathan

title: trees
text:
a lot of poems I did write
when I look back at
the end of my life
as I look at the trees
up high 
inhaling vape smoke 
I can't say no
the trees encode hidden messages
I want to explore myself
for the rest of my life
regardless of my job
or status
my holy communion 
with the trees of the three parks
in the stillness 
that's what it's all about

title: growth
text:
these past few weeks 
I have toiled with myself
crying on public footpaths
and feeling at one with the grey misty clouds 
I have carried a burden 
that makes me scared of the dark
and so alone 
sitting in my childhood house
with constant reminders 
everywhere
after much deliberation
attempts at meditation 
I found a book at just the right time
and all blames turned into one
finally I felt like I could unpack 
how I was feeling
and express it to my partner
in a calm, loving way
without setting off any bombs 
I wait for her response 
with my heart in my mouth 
for fear of conflict 
instead of ignoring it
I speak for this fear too
and how much lighter I feel
having my say
finally making a case
for the little parts inside me
the ones that are scared at being shouted at
the ones that are independent 
and ready for adventure
with my eyes open 
staring at nothing
I listen to their needs and wants 
instead of shutting them down
or worse
exiling them 
I make these cases humbly
to my girlfriend 
acknowledging my own part to play
in the misery
I can do all this
because I now feel safe 
in the boundaries 
of this relationship

title: cous cous
text:
you always
wanted 
me to
love
myself
now 
I'm crying
eating cous cous
the simplicity 
of it
it's our dish
how can this 
set me off
and the songs
and random images
of us 
living peacefully
in chorlton
you reach into
the fridge
we watch tv 
on the sofa
part of me 
screams 
no I don't 
want this 
to end

title: untitled
text:
a childlike 
innocent view of 
kissing
I'm wide open
all my lonely wanderings 
make sense now
I embody the
 adventure
through the weird 
fairy world 
that I've known my whole life
time to 
explore
 and express it 
unique to stoke on trent 
a vision that 
can't happen 
anywhere 
else

title: âme at sub club
text:
at âme
on a 
bench 
I submit
to the 
bass
with 
the help 
of 
gear

title: untitled
text:
lean clean 
the sun peeks 
super lean
eager cheeks 
mega clean
today's the day
who am I to say
it will go this or that way?
take a rest
scarborough castle 
before the test
before the hassle 
but is it strenuous
if you step back
and let
the dates prune
themselves?
sacred runes
and ancient bells 
exist behind 
the golden clock 
that time sells
evaporate 
and caffeinate
and gently wait 
for the live bait 
to demonstrate 
joy in the natural state 
to join in 
once again 
with the 
expression
of our beautiful 
universe

title: goat haiku
text:
co-op shop has goat
in aisle 3 head in the fridge
eating all the cheese

title: cow haiku
text:
rusty railway line
can't take the cows to stockport
a faulty brake light

title: haiku
text:
berlin wall stand tall 
shattered faith biscuit tin fall
around it's waist scum

title: apple haiku
text:
apple seeds grow tall
become trees fall in my lap
eat green granny smith

title: jonny haiku
text:
little jonny walk
he feels the ground go yellow
jonny fall down hole

title: rathdowne street
text:
every day after work
I walk along
rathdowne 
street 
in the sun
and stop off at the great
northern hotel
for a lime and 
soda
the bubbles rising
in the glass
I take a slow sip
the ice cubes
shining
like jewels

title: coffee cups
text: every morning the high flying workforce arrive to the city. you can tell us from our recyclable coffee cups. we wear them like badges of honour, copious amounts of us who actually think our coffee is better than anywhere else in the world. we actually think our coffee cups get recycled. every morning, white cups will pile up in special recycling points, one hole for the plastic lid, one for the paper cup. and we think we've done our bit. out of sight, out of mind. we're high flying city workers, perhaps we're entitled to it.

title: untitled
text:
rolling 
up 
my pension
plan
to
snort
this 
coke

title: untitled
text:
I'm being an insecure piece of shit at work 
we've been broken up for 3 months now
and I need to feel your love
remind myself it's not all so lonely 
and difficult
so I put on a song
and feel you washing over me
hugging me
to remind me what it's like

title: girlfriend size?
text:
you can
tell
a lot
about a 
man 
by the
size
of 
his 
girlfriend

title: espressos
text:
I drank three espressos 
and I'm still exhausted 
moving across the fault lines
guilty by design 
mostly serpentine and unfeeling 
come here and hug me

title: untitled
text:
in tokyo 
I just
saw
a man
wipe 
his 
dogs 
bottom

title: on the train in japan
text:
I am becoming intimately aware with the zippers and crotches
of the men standing in front of me
the girl reading her book with a grimace
the fold of all the business mens trousers
the pretty girls and the western families
the ones in kangol caps 
I love them all and I see beneath 
to their hearts 
because mine is broken 
the hearts beneath all the fancy clothing
and impenetrable cultural references
are the same for everyone 
why have I not seen this before?
something so simple and pure

title: leaving melbourne
text:
airport taxi sunset 
bleeding sweets 
eyes burning with slobber 
disgusting and mild 
wayward seat sitter
bus squatter 
I fly away
squarely sat on a chair
trying to avoid 
the sinking 
coffees to say goodbye 
then take off 
bye bye bye 
the sky bus 
blue vials
that makes you throw 
your arms about 
like a baby

title: dolphins
text:
dolphins
of the big blue 
are mammals
like me and you 
bottlenosed
in the indo pacific
I say hello to you 
with a whistle and click

smiling with your teeth
your true feelings are blocked to me
but wenmix and float
in the cold bath, the mighty sea

title: hug
text:
when I hug you
it feels so painful
I hold onto fragments
when we were
first together 
my mind won't even let me go back there now 
it'll take me years
but I know right now
I need you to feel safe
in my arms 
while you sleep

title: big fleshy balloon
text:
it's hard 
to let go
of 
smoking
weed 
when your 
girlfriend's 
bum feels
like 
a 
big fleshy balloon 
and 
you're 
bouncing
your face
on it

title: all the little birdies
text:
I provide the shade 
for the little birdie 
it's a metaphor for life!
I will.keep you cool
a goretex jacket 
to give you shelter from the storm mate
I want to do this for everyone 
in any capacity
drunk or sober
anywhere 
anytime
I will provide you all with shade
I am the ginger lad 
with insecurity issues 
but I will put that all aside 
and talk melliflously 
so as not to disturb your ears
like water I will adapt and flow 
into any situation 
like the buddha 
I will help people on their side quests 
and not ask for anything in return
I will provide all you little birdies with shade
and I'm not being patronising 
I am a little birdie too
but when I give myself 
I am released to grow as tall as a mountain 
I am the weather 
feeding your grass with rain
in the form of poems
and actually listening 
I will capture real emotion with drawings 
and release them 
songs that communicate the joy of my pain 
and I will let them all go 
as generous as can be
smoking a pipe 
and not wanting anything in return 
I don't mind sitting in the corner
being quiet and lonely
and waiting for the right time 
I will provide you all with shade
all the little birdies

title: untitled
text:
when we argue
and get down to it
and nearly break up 
I come to my senses 
and return home 

it's the first time
I feel anonymous 
walking down chapel street

the world doesn't realise 
how broken
it is
there's too much brunch

title: walk poem
text:
mantis ray
tattooed guy 
card handed in by well wishing stranger 
I am the roadside walker
past enchanted farm land
grey skies 
and green grass like cordial
I drink it all in
really having no idea where I'm going
and wanting to be elevated 
another stretch 
a new field 
and an alpaca 
backed up by his little mates 
behind him

title: food and beverage attendant
text:
28 year old food and beverage attendant 
slowly unravel from years and years 
of a stressful job
and learn to serve plates 
but still I wonder around collecting glasses
with a crazed expression 
scaring the customers
I'm a slow learner

title: sunset
text:
the sun sets on the church steeple
and the orange pokes through the trees
the birds look like bats 
and locusts call out
flies bite my legs 
and dog owners lurk in the dark
then the water fountains turned on
paid for by the church 
your favourite colour is blue 
mine is orange 
together 
we make the sunset

title: tram girl
text:
that girl with the flowy curly hair
feeling herself
walking 
looking from side to side
that feeling
of feeling yourself 
being in your body 
and feeling good
makes me feel warm now
and I wizz past her on the tram

title: that youthful feeling
text:
that youthful feeling
when things were so bright and bright
you could squeeze the juice
out of the sunshine
you felt alive with your friends
and the music carried you through
the green of the trees
to the sky 
infinity
I can't get it anymore 
that youthful feeling 
but I feel more grounded now
is it a worthy exchange?
sometimes a song will remind me 
of it
and it's okay
that it's gone 
I'm not haunted
but I keep trying to get there
and now the world feels more real 
right? 
the world feels more real

title: untitled
text:
it feels so strange 
that you love me

like I don't deserve it 
like I don't deserve anyone

while you sleep
I finally become clear
watching your breathe
so deep and easy 
always letting go
your love for me 
is always letting go

title: drinking
text:
I'm drinking
it makes your mind blank 
staring into space
hearing naked sound 
from the conversations 
of other people 
I conclude that
no one here talks with any energy 
but slowly the posturing 
goes away
and what's left
is seeing myself
in every single face
and I know it will be me someday
I'm looking at a hole in the sky 
the clouds burnt 
with white embers

title: homeless singer
text:
I am the slow lover of bruises 
of soft cuts and scars
from the one on my nose
the feelings pour out like blood 
I am the slow lover of simple things 
simple songs sung by you
the busker
I can feel the earth in your voice
and want to cry 
listening to you
in your pink shirt
and tattered trousers 
I can see it in your eyes 
beautiful homeless singer

title: weed man
text:
weed man
gonna pick up 
for some excitement
lonely soul
on saturday 
pure pleasure 
call my momma 
call my mate jake
pommy fuck
shouldn't be ashamed
gonna get money in soon
and I've joined my union 
of artists
and 808 bass 
sydney bass

title: breakup poem
text:
why
is it 
only now
that the 
feelings 
come 
gushing 
I can 
listen to 
songs
I've avoided for
months 
I see love
in all the
pedestrian 
faces 
why do we 
regress 
at the 
end of a 
relationship 
to the feelings
from the 
start?
I drive around
crying
listening to
the songs 
you put in 
my playlist
and I see you
clearly
for the 
first time
in months 
years 
why?
and 
what 
now?

title: britishnes
text:
how long before the confidence I've gained
is wittled away
by the british mentality 
and the passive aggression?
I feel my jaw clench when I walk past my locals
feel myself crawl into myself
happy to not share what im passionate about
to keep to myself and hide it all behind
a forced half smile 
and a I'm fine thanks 
how are you?

title: untitled
text:
the bridge is a jungle 
with the faces that I see 

beautiful pink palace
in the forest 

an emotion 
from me to you

title: falafel
text:
my girl makes thick balls of falafel
next to her thicc booty 
with this twinkly little country number playin
maybe this is how henry 8th felt 
like a pure don
* you look like a lumberjack
she said
in my walking boots and shorts

title: keep making
text:
keep making 
it's all worth while
it's all good 
better than you think 
before anyone believes in you
just express yourself
that's enough

title: night bus
text:
crossing state lines
move through cold sunshine
lips cracked and 
shoes dusty 

a stomach bug 
from dirty meat
I'm running out of time 
on the hell bus 
flying through the night 
flying through the night
